title: Beautiful story that takes you away.
content: I picked this book because I was going to my friends wedding on the Amalfi coast. I heard about this book from a podcast episode of What Should I Read Next and they did a book flight and this was one for Italy. While my intention was to read it there, I was to busy experiencing my first trip to Europe. I started this book on the way home and boy was it the right book at the right time. It was great to be taken back to the place I just got to visit. While we didn't stay in Positano, we got to visit it a couple times on our trip and did and saw a lot of what was described in this book. Also, while it wasn't the loss of my mom, my family lost a very close friend and this book does a beautiful job of capturing what it means to find yourself again after loss or even just your day to day life. Sometimes it feels like you wake up and realize wait what is happening and where did the time go and this book reminds you that it's important to not lose yourself in your life. And in know it might be cliche, but Italy and the Amalfi Coast is magical and has this was of taking you out of your life and taking you to another time all the while reminding you to stay present. While this book may not be for everyone, it was the perfect book at the perfect time for me.

title: Traveling, Timeless Traveling
content: ****Perhaps, what we most forget about loss and grief is love. The greater the love, the greater the grief. And when a daughter loses her mother, a mother who has been her best friend, the grief is so great that it creates a chasm, a void that threatens to suck all love, all her life, all that has defined her including her marriage. Fortunately, she chooses to travel to Italy and complete the trip she and her mother had been planning before her illness and inevitable demise. And there in Italy, she begins to experience life again, to reawaken and realize truths about her mother, about herself, and about her choices.
